alert.note: Alert for Lower Kuskokwim Valley (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued October 15 at 4:15PM AKDT until October 16 at 2:00PM AKDT by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 2 PM AKDT MONDAY... * WHAT...Mixed precipitation expected. Total snow accumulations of up to 4 inches and ice accumulations up to two tenths of an inch. Highest snow accumulations expected west of Sleetmute. Highest ice accumulations expected along the Kuskokwim Mountains east of Crooked Creek and south of Stony River. * WHERE...Lower Kuskokwim Valley. * WHEN...Until 2 PM AKDT Monday. * IMPACTS...Plan on difficult travel conditions. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Forecast precipitation amounts have increased since the previous update, leading to the potential for greater snow and ice accumulations overnight. Otherwise, we continue to expect the highest chances of freezing rain from Crooked Creek east and north of Koliganek, between the Kuskokwim Mountains and Western Alaska Range. Crooked Creek will mark the approximate transition zone in precipitation type, with areas to its west more likely to see snow and areas to its east more likely to see freezing rain/ice.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling.
